intro: Mildella intramarginalis, commonly known as the narrowleaf mildella, is a small flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers with four petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Mildella intramarginalis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
